content:
I got the problem during solving this clash - my solution passes every test case, except for "Validator 1".
It seems that it's the only test where node have specific order of traversal, which makes queue-based solution to fail. Stack and recursive variants are doing just fine.

Could you please add more validators to cover this problem?

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting problem to solve, right level of difficulty.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem, right level of difficulty

Please standardise how a leaf's label is described.
- In the Statement, you refer to "the text values of all the leaves"
- Later in the Statement, it's a [[label]].
- In the Input section, it's "the value of the leaf".
- In the Output section, its "the text on the leaf".

Goal: 
Please change "constructs the tree" to "construct the tree"
Please change "and then concatenates" to "and then concatenate"
Please change "represent the root", to "represents the root"

Output:
Please change "The text on each leaf" to "A single line of text, containing the [[label]] of each <<leaf>>"

It's at the hard end of a clash, but still achievable, and most importantly, it was fun to figure out.

Upvoted!
I hope you received enough feedback from the community to improve your contribution. Once you have made the necessary updates, publish your contribution!

It is a good problem. But I don’t know if it is not a little to long for a clash.

It took me 20 minutes to do it in C language.

Goal
* Delete "OBJECTIF".

* I can't find any instructions.

Input
* Please change "The first line [[N]] contains" to "<<Line 1>>: An integer [[N]] for".

* Please change "The [[N]] following lines describe" to "<<Next [[N]] lines>>: A string [[node]] for".

* Please move the example to Goal section.

Output
* Please change "You need to give the" to "The".

* Please change "concatenate" to "concatenated".

Constraints
* Please delete "You can use resistivity".

Thanks.
Thank you for your feedback. UPDATED.

Updated,
Sorry for the respond time im a bit overbooked with my studies does time.
+ I don't find the error in goal you told me, don't know if I already update it or not.

Thank you for you review
you shouldn't put solutions here since people can cheat by copying you. i only came here to see if anyone else took a long time to solve this lol
Sorry for the problem I will switch to number in test 1 to make this coherent.
It's been a few day, i wonder how did you find the contribution ? Because i search and didn't find how to found other ones contribution.
This is basic tree traversal btw

Constraints
* Please change "deep" to "depth".

Goal
* Instructions are still missing.

Thanks again.
Thank again for your feedback. It's my first contribution, i don't know how i can explain Goal.
You may explain, for example, how the node indices in the input should be interpreted.
Thank. UPDATED
OK. How do I know which node corresponds to which node/leaf?
Updated

Thank you. I think I can understand the requirements now.

Goal
* Please change "it's two" to "its two".

* Please change "the line" to "the lines".

* Please change "A children" to "A child".

* Please change "Either" to "either".

* Suggest to add "(index {{0}})" after "The first line".

* Suggest to format "root" in <<bold>>.

* Please change "concatenated" to "concatenating".

* Please change "An simple" to "A simple".

* Please change "understood" to "understand".

Input
* Suggest to add "(index {{0}})" after "The first line".

Constraints
* Please change "deep" to "depth".

Thanks.
Thanks, I think this is good now ?

It looks good to me now. Just one more fix:

Goal
* Please change "the index" to "the indices".

Of course, other reviewers may have their comments too.

Thanks.
Thank you for all your help
